column4: hey somebody refered me to a thread but what its telling me to do is not working would somebody mind helping??? the thread is http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=190177 its about wifi with broadcom 4318
have you tried fwcutter before ndis wrapper?
Why on another channel?
Undo whatever those instructions said to do and then install bcm43xx-fwcutter from synaptic
Do you know how to undo what those instructions say?
What GPU?
What Video card do you have?
intel?
What is the output of "glxinfo | grep direct" ?
What is the output of "glxinfo | grep direct" ?
It should be just one line, like "direct rendering = yes"
Are you sure you type it in correctly?
There is a space after "grep"
glxinfo | grep direct
What does hardware info say your graphics card is?
try running: "sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg -phigh" and choose i810 when asked for a driver
as for your wireless problems, do you know how to undo the instructions that you followed on ubuntuforums.org ?
If that would be easier for you sure
Let me check, what is the link again?
If you havn't got any important data then sure
#ubuntu-classroom is for low traffic support
I am already there :)
never left :)
First lets make it so that your firmware will be updated automatically when new versions come out, open synaptic and install bcm43xx-fwcutter
